page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY.
page.content: In the Domesday Book,only one Brampton(Saxon for Briar,or Bramble farm) is mentioned.Church Brampton held a long narrow strip of land a field width from the Nene to Holdenby East Lodge.The prefix Church was first used in 1287.The origin of Harlestone is possibly from the Saxon "Harle" meaning draw and "Stone",a reference to the local stone quarries.There is no longer a village at Althorp which was depopulated. There are several old buildings in the villages,the most interesting being the "Dovecote" in Harlestone.It was built in 1320 to serve one of the manors and was constructed to provide nesting for 400 pairs of birds. Horse racing was held on Harlestone Heath,which was part of the heaths covering 18th.century Northamptonshire.
